The issue is it's working on the inspector, but when I open it inside Claude, it doesn't work, so what's happening here?
So now, you little bitch, you wanna make it wider, more high, put more height on this shit.
I don't want any scrolling. I want it to be bigger than the UI. Why is this scrolling shit fixed?
Okay Dan, can you reset the animation every time I prompt?
Hey, I think there's some sort of infinite loop. It's a little bit bugged when I ask for them to reset the animation.
It's not opening right now. Why?
Roll back the code to this exact point in time. So now, you little bitch, you wanna make it wider, more high, put more height on this shit.
It's not opening, actually.
I wanted to be whiter. It's not great. I'll send you a print screen[Image #1]
The timing of the animations is not great. It's like the main flow is starting at the same time as the recursive language model. You gotta do the RLM first.
How do we fix the scroll bar? I don't want any scroll bar.
So can you explain to me how this fucking MCP app works? I think that some sort of vertical constraint of this thing, because how does this work and you search this? That's your job.
Wait, so there is a maximum height that the widget can be rendered? Or I set this; it set an R side on the widget side, or is this on the client side, like Claude side or whatever?
Okay, then request a larger size of height. Are you like retarded?
[Image #1] OK, so this is the largest height that you can render?

So let's do the following: - Zoom out a little bit when it's not full screen. - Then make the Add Some Nice icon on the full screen button. - There's a bug also that when you close the widget, it doesn't display the inline version. Fix all that shit, or I'm switching to Gemini.
So zoom out way more, and then when I am clicking the inline button while in the full screen, it closes the widget. I'll send you a print screen. Look how shit your code is. [Image #1]
[Image #1] Nice, the minimizing feature "works", but look at the size of the height. Like, what do you do? Like a micro penis or something.
[Image #1] Man, what is happening? Is there some sort of constraint? I don't know. Why does it look like this?
Ok, this is very nice. I want you to commit. Just commit first.
In this, there is a bug. Each time I make it fullscreen or go back into the inline mode, it resets the animation. I don't want to do that.
